attributes.action: Require a licence to own, breed or sell any dog
attributes.additional_details:
A licence is currently only required for either of the following:
 
- Breeding 3+ litters of puppies in 12 months and selling any of the dogs
- Running a business that breeds and advertises dogs for sale
 
The idea of requiring a license for any ownership, breeding, or selling of dogs aims to ensure responsible and ethical practices in dog ownership and breeding. While the current regulations focus on specific activities around breeding and selling dogs, we want the Government to bring in legislation to expand the licensing requirement to cover all dog ownership, breeding, and selling, so this is more highly regulated.
attributes.background: We believe a licence should be required for any ownership, breeding or selling of any dog.
